sense.name: feeling of affection, empathy
sense.examples: The child has a deep attachment to his grandfather. Mary's attachment to her parents' old summer cottage prevented her from selling it.

sense.name: a removable device that is an accessory to larger object
sense.commentary: ATTACHMENT[+entity][+artifact][+component][+accessory][+removable][+device] Note: implies the accessory serves a function - it is not a connector however, see Sense 4 Note: It is a PATIENT which is attached to a PARENT object.
sense.examples: Sally bought a meat grinder attachment for her electric mixing bowl. I can't find the upholstery attachment to the vacuum cleaner.

sense.name: an authorization or writ to legally seize property
sense.examples: The lawyer explained the meaning of the attachment to his client. Only the previously-mentioned assets are exempt from attachment, garnishment or seizure under a legal process.

sense.name: a fastener
sense.commentary: ATTACHMENT[+entity][+artifact][+component][+fastener] The component of an artifact whose purpose is to join separate things together. Note: It is an INSTRUMENT which does the attaching of two PATIENT objects.
sense.examples: The small attachment of Jane's necklace clasp broke. The leash's attachment is a simple metal clip.

sense.name: ongoing social commitment or adherence to something
sense.examples: Mary's attachment to the country club has been diminishing in recent years. His attachment to formal written agendas is slowing us down.

sense.name: the act of physically affixing or connecting things
sense.examples: The case has a loop for convenient attachment to your belt. My attachment of the glass globe to its metal stand with glue was not successful.

sense.name: a computer file appended to an email message
sense.examples: I'll send you an attachment with my comments on the report. Mary couldn't open the attachments because they were in the wrong format.
